oai_dc:dc.dc:title: About quantum mechanics interpretation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kyriakos, Alexander G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There is a certainty that the modern (Copenhagen's) interpretation of quantum mechanics is correct. However, the some physicist had the opinion that the modern quantum mechanics is a phenomenological theory. The suggested theory is the new quantum mechanics interpretation that is entirely according to the modern interpretation and gives a number of results, which naturally explain the postulates of the modern quantum mechanics.
